title: aria-errormessage attribute
description: Identifies the element that provides an error message for the object.  See related aria-invalid and aria-describedby.

assertions.title: convey that the referenced error message is pertinent
assertions.rationale: Users need to know that the error message exists when the input is in an aria-invalid="true" state
examples: screen readers might convey the accessible name of the referenced ID
screen readers might announce that an error message is present and provide a shortcut to jump to the error message

assertions.title: convey the error when the error message is NOT pertinent
assertions.rationale: Users should not be made aware of the error message when the input is not in an error state
examples: when an input has an error message but also has aria-invalid="false", the error message will not be conveyed because it is not pertinent
